items.title: Software Developer
items.description: I like making things that work well and feel like they were made for someone — not just deployed. Whether it's a browser-based game or a custom AI assistant, I build tools that are meant to be used, not just looked at.

items.title: Graphic Designer
items.description: My background is in design — 3D modeling, texture work, interface design. That’s where I learned to solve problems visually and care about how things feel, not just how they function.

items.title: Computer Science Student
items.description: Currently at WGU, filling in the gaps. I’ve always been self-taught, but I wanted to formalize my learning and challenge myself with real computer science. Looking for a software development internship while I study.

items.title: Disc Golf Enjoyer
items.description: There’s something perfect about chasing a flying disc through the woods. It’s quiet, cheap, social, and slightly competitive, like debugging, but with trees.

items.title: AI Enthusiast
items.description: I'm experimenting with ai, voice interfaces, and personal tooling. There's so much potential and I am working hard to see what useful systems I can build for myself and others.

items.title: Creative Problem Solver
items.description: I like figuring things out. Whether it's a puzzle or a piece of software. I’m drawn to what doesn’t have an obvious solution yet.

items.title: User Focused Creator
items.description: I care about how things feel to use. Design and code aren’t separate for me. While I believe in the concept of 'form follows function' I also believe that form is just as important as function. What good is a toll if a user doesn't want to use it?

items.title: Collaborative Builder
items.description: I’ve worked solo and with teams. I like both, but I’ve learned that a lot more is possible when you are working together. Plus, struggling through the bugs with someone else is way more fun.

items.title: Forever in Beta
items.description: This is how I live my life. I'm always working on something, learning, and improving who I am. Learning is never done and so I am never done learning.

items.title: Personal Life Assistant
items.description:
A voice powered personal assistant that helps you manage your tasks and schedules. It runs locally, handles task management, and connects to my other tools. Built with Python, Flask, and Godot, and designed with privacy in mind.
Check it out on GitHub

items.title: Skiing Video Game
items.description:
Building a simple video game as a learning experience. An homage to a game I remember playing fondly as a kid, Ski Free. Adding my own twist on the gameplay and design to make it my own.
Check it out on GitHub

items.title: Table Top Tracker
items.description:
A full-stack app for organizing board game collections and getting AI-powered game recommendations. I led the team of eight, including myself, coordinated front-end and back-end development, and helped guide the UX from idea to implementation.
Check it out on GitHub
